ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè, míŋ Akaze wembàŋa la gwaa cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ pà Yúndà, mbà Oze míŋ Ela wembàŋa neŋé na lʉŋe lefùɔ pà Ésàlayɛ ngùʼ tá.
en: In the third year of Israel’s King Hoshea   son of Elah, Hezekiah  # 18:1 2Ch 28:27 son of Ahaz became king of Judah.

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè la gwaa cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ púʼu, ńgẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b tʉ̂a lé móm mbʉ́a, ńnéŋe Yelúzálèm ésáʼa láʼa Yúndà ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔʼɔ́ lé móm mbʉ́a, lezíŋ má we laa lê Ambi, à gwɔ́ míŋ Sakalíɛ.
en: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Abi   daughter of Zechariah.

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á poŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ mángʉanjʉʼ we fùɔ Ndavîd.
en: He did what was right in the Lord’s sight just as his ancestor David had done.

ngiemboon: Ye zɔ la pú ḿbyág mejʉʼ ssé, ńgÿo mé shʉ́ate metǒon mie mé la pʉʼʉ ńtÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g, ńzáʼte mentóon jʉʼʉ ssé. À la gÿo mé shʉ́ate tútú nnú gie Mǒonsê la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte; ńtí nue á laa fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ gíŋ ńké ńne ńgee mvfò yɔɔn nnú gie mé tóŋo lê Nehushÿetaŋ ńtuɔ lìi tuɔ.
en: He removed the high places, shattered the sacred pillars, and cut down the Asherah poles.   He broke into pieces the bronze snake that Moses made,  # 18:4 Nm 21:5–9 for until then the Israelites were burning incense to it. It was called Nehushtan.  # 18:4 = A Bronze Thing

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè la cʉ́me nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a té mʉ́ʼte, tà ńcʉa pʉ̀a pie é la vɔg ńgwɔ́ mefùɔ á tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Yúndà, mbɔɔ pie é ge láʼ tá gwɔ́ mefùɔ.
en: Hezekiah relied on the Lord God of Israel;   not one of the kings of Judah was like him, either before him or after him.  # 18:5 1Kg 3:12; 2Kg 23:25

ngiemboon: À la cʉŋe na Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tà à te láʼ fó nzèm yé ésẅɛʼte nnɛ́ wɔ́. À la giŋ páʼ mentÿɔgɔ́ mie à la náa mbwó Mǒonsê la ne ńzɛ́te.
en: He remained faithful to the Lord    and did not turn from following him but kept the commands the Lord had commanded Moses.

ngiemboon: À cʉa púʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gwɔ́ lé yé, á gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, á giŋ giŋ. À la tʉʉ twó mbwó fùɔ Asili tà à te gíŋ ńzẅíŋ ntÿɔ́ʼ ye wɔ́.
en: The Lord was with him, and wherever he went he prospered.   He rebelled against the king of Assyria and did not serve him.  # 18:7 2Kg 16:7

ngiemboon: À la gíŋ ńdÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a Filisi lé ncù tá ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼ Ngaza, ńjÿó wɔ́b. Ńgíŋ ńkẅé mendá náŋ, mbɔɔ metÿǒsoŋ mie mé la kwɛ́ metʉ̂ankáʼ nkáʼ ńdɔg ńkéle.
en: He defeated the Philistines as far as Gaza and its borders,   from watchtower  # 18:8 2Kg 17:9 to fortified city.

ngiemboon: Á laa na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ lekùɔ, léfó páʼ fùɔ Ezekiyásè la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ pà Yúndà, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a léfó páʼ Oze míŋ Ela la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ, Salemanasaa gʉa ńtíʼi tÿǒsoŋo Samalîɛ.
en: In the fourth year of King Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Israel’s King Hoshea son of Elah, Assyria’s King Shalmaneser marched against Samaria and besieged it.

ngiemboon: À la lÿɔ́ʼ ngùʼ tá, tá ńkẅé tÿǒsoŋo Samalîɛ. Ńkẅé púʼu na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ ntɔgɔ́ léfó páʼ Ezekiyásè la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ pà Yúndà, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ lepfwɔʼɔ́ léfó páʼ Oze la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ.
en: The Assyrians captured it at the end of three years. In the sixth year of Hezekiah, which was the ninth year of Israel’s King Hoshea, Samaria was captured.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Asili la gwóon patsẅé tÿǒsoŋo Ésàlayɛ ńdɔg ńgʉa né láʼ yé. Ńkúu wɔ́, ńgÿo pɔ́ tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼa Ala, ńtsẅé ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Ngozaŋ, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ Mendayi.
en: The king of Assyria deported the Israelites to Assyria and put them in Halah, along the Habor (Gozan’s river), and in the cities of the Medes,

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò lɔ́ɔn ńgÿo páʼɔɔn, ńtí páʼ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ la te júʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé yɔb wɔ́, ńké te gẅiin pyennɛ́ na kʉ̀a gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gÿo pâ pɔ̌ gwá wɔ́, pɔ́ la te júʼ membʉ̌ mie Mǒonsê gẅie aa ngàŋafàʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la ná né pɔ́b wɔ́, ḿbiŋ te giŋ páʼ é né ńzɛ́te wɔ́.
en: because they did not listen to the Lord their God but violated his covenant #— #all he had commanded Moses the servant of the Lord. They did not listen, and they did not obey.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ léfó páʼ fùɔ Ezekiyásè la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ pà Yúndà, afùɔ Senashÿelib tó ńdÿɔ́ʼ metÿǒsoŋ né ncù, ńgwoon ńkẅé, é metÿǒsoŋ mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Yúndà mbà mé la kwɛ́ menkàŋnkáʼ ńdɔg ńkéle.
en: In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, Assyria’s King Sennacherib attacked all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, Ezekiyásè, fùɔ pà Yúndà túm ngie mé gʉa ńtsẅii mbwó fùɔ pà Asili gẅie aa láʼ Lakíshÿè ngie: «N ka fʉa tàʼa nò! Pɔ́ɔn le gíŋe ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́ɔn, ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzɛ́te kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, mbà n ge ná.» Afùɔ Asili leen ńké ńzáʼa yé nkáb metónà lepfwɔʼɔ́ ńgíŋe ńgÿo tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ mekílò nkÿo lepfwɔʼɔ́.
en: So King Hezekiah of Judah sent word to the king of Assyria at Lachish:   “I have done wrong;  # 18:14 Is 24:5; 33:8 withdraw from me. Whatever you demand from me, I will pay.” The king of Assyria demanded eleven tons  # 18:14 Lit 300 talents of silver and one ton  # 18:14 Lit 30 talents of gold from King Hezekiah of Judah.

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè pú ńná nkáb ntsèm gie e laa ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbɔɔ shúm fùʼ sie é laa tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ.
en: So Hezekiah gave him all the silver found in the Lord’s temple and in the treasuries of the king’s palace.

ngiemboon: Ńgíŋ ńtsɔ́ʼte mepàg tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ mie à la néŋe na mencwò ndá Ssé mbɔɔ na mentóon, ńnáa né fùɔ pà Asili.
en: At that time Hezekiah stripped the gold from the doors of the Lord’s sanctuary and from the doorposts he had overlaid and gave it to the king of Assyria.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Asili la fó Lakíshÿè, ńtúmo tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à tyé twómvfò na megàŋafàʼ, ńgÿo tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù, pɔ́ lɔg palÿɔ́ʼncù tà é gyɔ́ɔn ńgʉa. Pɔ́ la gʉa tà ńkúu Yelúzálèm, ńgʉa ńtyé ngʉ̀ŋe sóŋ tâŋ gẅie aa twó kwóŋ, á na mánzsè gẅie à gee né nkáʼ pasɔg menzsǒ.
en: Then the king of Assyria sent the field marshal,   the chief of staff, and his royal spokesman, along with a massive army, from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem.  # 18:17 2Ch 32:9 They advanced and came to Jerusalem, and  # 18:17 LXX, Syr, Vg; MT reads and came and they took their position by the aqueduct of the upper pool, by the road to the Launderer’s Field.  # 18:17 2Kg 20:20; Is 7:3

ngiemboon: Ńzɛ́te légɔɔn nò mbwó fùɔ. Táʼ, Eliakim gẅie aa míŋ Hilekiya wembàŋa, ńgwɔ́ ŋwáláʼ tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ zɔ̌ fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ lézáʼa wɔ́b, pâ Shʉbna gẅie aa ntẅènzóŋ lé Yoha gẅie aa lùŋncwò fùɔ, ńgwɔ́ míŋ Asáfè, é gwɔ́.
en: They called for the king, but Eliakim   son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the palace, Shebnah  # 18:18 Is 22:15 the court secretary, and Joah son of Asaph, the court historian, came out to them.  # 18:17–18 Is 36:2–3

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à tyé twómvfò na megàŋafàʼ gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Afùɔ Asili gẅie aa fùɔ we lÿo láʼ yɔɔn, gɔ̌ɔn ngie peg zɛ́te gú ngie: Aa wɔ̌ gẅie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ yé ńtʉʉ tà ɔ̀ těen ḿbɔ́gɔ wɔ́ɔ?
en: Then   the royal spokesman said to them, “Tell Hezekiah this is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says: ‘What are you relying on?  # 18:19 Lit ‘What is this trust which you trust,# 18:19 2Kg 18:5; 2Ch 32:10

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ kwǎŋ ngie ngwɔ́ meshwóŋè ndàʼ pɔ́ shÿɔ̀g é kúbe nkwaŋá ncù la? Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ wɔ̌ nyìŋ ńtʉʉ tà ńtʉʉ twó mbwó mèŋ páʼɔɔn?
en: You think mere words are strategy and strength for war. Who are you now relying on so that you have rebelled against me?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ pʉ̀a Egíbtò ńtʉʉ la? Egíbtò ŋwɛ́ aa páʼ kèkàʼa gie á pwɔʼɔ́ éshʉ́a pwó nyìŋ gẅie à kibé. Gyá mmó gie Falahoŋ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ yɛ̌, á mbwó pʉ̀a metsèm pie é sáŋa yɔ́b nò ńtÿɔ́gɔ na yé!
en: Now look, you are relying on Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff   that will pierce the hand of anyone who grabs it and leans on it.  # 18:21 Ezk 29:6–7 This is what Pharaoh king of Egypt is to all who rely on him.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̀ʼ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó mèŋ ngie: Pi lɔgɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gi ńtʉʉ. Táʼ, kwàʼ gú Ezekiyásè la pyág mejʉʼ ssé laa mejʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, ńgɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a Yelúzálèm pâ pʉ̀a Yúndà ngie pɔ́ cʉ́ʼʉ ńguʼte Ssé pɔ́ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ á Yelúzálèm
en: Suppose you say to me, “We rely on the Lord our God.” Isn’t he the one whose high places and altars Hezekiah has removed,   saying to Judah and to Jerusalem, “You must worship at this altar in Jerusalem” ? ’

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, pi táfàʼ wɔ̀ɔn fùɔ pà Asili záʼ nkwèen: N kuʼu léná melÿóon ntsáʼ pʉ̀a á mbwó gù, páʼ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgẅiin pashwòŋo.
en: “So now, make a bargain with my master the king of Assyria. I’ll give you two thousand horses if you’re able to supply riders for them!

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ zɔɔn te kuʼ páʼ ngwɔ́ ɔ̀ jwoŋo tàʼ na púɔ megàŋafàʼ táfà wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́! Ḿbiŋe ńdɔgɔ ngwòŋ Egíbtò, é sáŋa nò, ngie à ge ná mekélêg ncù pâ melÿóon lé gù!
en: How then can you drive back a single officer   among the least of my master’s servants? How can you rely on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?

ngiemboon: Tsye ngwɔ́ mbà táfàʼ wɔ̀ɔn ka tóo tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gú ńgee pɔ́ ḿbyág ngwòŋ té gwɔ́ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zẅǐŋ ka? Ngǎŋ! Kwàʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a yé máŋwɛ́ zɔ ka tsẅi né yé!
en: Now, have I attacked this place to destroy it without the Lord’s approval?   The Lord said to me, ‘Attack this land and destroy it.’ ”

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu Eliakim, míŋ Hikiya wembàŋa, ńgÿo shʉbna pɔ́ Yowa sẅíŋte tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù welÿò ngie: «Tsetsɔ́ʼ lɔgɔ shwóŋè pʉ̀a Alam ńgɔɔn nò né peg, á nue peg ne ńjúʼu. Pɔ́ɔn le lɔgɔ shwóŋè Ébɛ̀ ńgɔɔn nò né peg, mélàʼmie aláʼa ntsèm gie á tyé na menkàŋnkáʼ tÿǒsoŋ ne ńzẅíʼte.»
en: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, Shebnah, and Joah said to the royal spokesman, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic,   since we understand it. Don’t speak with us in Hebrew  # 18:26 Lit Judahite, also in v. 28 within earshot of the people on the wall.”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù welÿò tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Pi kwǎŋ ngie nkʉ̀ táfàʼ wɔ̀ɔn é líe pɔ́ ndàʼ gẅí lâ fùɔ keen? Ngǎŋ, é gíŋe ńdíe pʉ̀a metsèm pie é tyéte na nkàŋnkáʼ tÿǒsoŋ lɛ̂, pi lâ pɔ̌ ge jÿó nzɛ́ mɔ́b, é piŋ nú metsìtsì mɔ́b tà ntyě té gíŋ sag wɔ́.»
en: But the royal spokesman said to them, “Has my master sent me to speak these words only to your master and to you? Hasn’t he also sent me to the men who sit on the wall, destined with you to eat their own excrement and drink their own urine? ”

ngiemboon: Tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù welÿò leen ńké ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè Ébɛ̀ ńgɔɔn nò né ngyè tetʉ̂ ngie: «Pi júʼ nkʉ̀ gẅie fùɔ welÿò, ńgwɔ́ fùɔ pà Asili tsẅǐi:
en: The royal spokesman stood and called out loudly in Hebrew: “Hear the word of the great king, the king of Assyria.

ngiemboon: Tá pi zẅíŋ tà Ezekiyásè fʉte gẅí: À te kuʼ páʼ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ à fó mbwó mèŋ ńkẅé gẅí wɔ́.
en: This is what the king says: ‘Don’t let Hezekiah deceive   you; he can’t rescue you from my power.  # 18:29 2Ch 32:15

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè ne ńgɔɔn né pi ngie pi záb letʉ́m sí na Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lêkɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, mbà à ge gÿo pi tsẅɛ́. À ne ńgɔɔn ngie fùɔ Asili te kẅé tÿǒsoŋ yɔɔn wɔ́.
en: Don’t let Hezekiah persuade you to rely on the Lord by saying, “Certainly the Lord will rescue us! This city will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.” ’

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn le zẅíʼte nò gie Ezekiyásè gɔɔn, ńtí nue fùɔ Asili ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi cʉ́me nzèm yé, ńgÿo mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi lâ pɔ̌, tá à cʉa púʼu, awɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ na pi à kuʼu léjÿó ntɔ́ɔn tÿǒ gẅie é kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼa metÿǒ melùʼ mé, ńjÿó mentɔ̌ɔn pÿɛ̀ mé, ḿbiŋ ńnú ntse gẅie é kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ we.
en: “Don’t listen to Hezekiah, for this is what the king of Assyria says: ‘Make peace   with me and surrender to me. Then each of you may eat from his own vine and his own fig tree,  # 18:31 1Kg 4:25 and each may drink water from his own cistern

ngiemboon: Tà n dáʼ ńtó ńdɔgɔ gẅí ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie ée páʼ gẅí, é ngwòŋ gẅie ngesáŋ ntsíŋ ee wó, melùʼ sẅé ee wó, mbelég gwɔ́ wó, metÿǒ mevɛ́ olive mie é náa mevɛ́ gwɔ́ wó, metÿǒ mie é náa melùʼ gwɔ́ wó, tà mbɔɔ melwòŋwáʼ. Pi te kúu wó kwéte wɔ́, pi ge tsẅé wó é gwɔ́ ntentʉ́. Pi pɔ́ɔn le zẅíʼte nò gie Ezekiyásè ne ńgɔɔn, ńtí nue ngwɔ́ á lÿɔ́gte gẅí ńgɔɔn ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo pege tsẅɛ́.
en: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land #— #a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive trees and honey    #— #so that you may live  # 18:32 Dt 30:19 and not die. But don’t listen to Hezekiah when he misleads you, saying, “The Lord will rescue us.”

ngiemboon: Pi la gyá péʼe messé metsɔ́ mengwòŋ é táte wɔ́ɔn fùɔ Asili lékẅé mengwòŋ mɔ́b ka?
en: Has any of the gods of the nations ever rescued   his land from the power of the king of Assyria?

ngiemboon: Messé Amad pɔ́ me Aapad la gÿo kɔ́? Messé me Sefaavayîm, pâ me Hénà, mbɔɔ me Ava é gÿo kɔ́? Tà pɔ́ la táte wɔ́ɔn lékẅé tÿǒsoŋo Samalîɛ?
en: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?   Have they rescued Samaria from my power?  # 18:34 2Kg 17:24; 19:13

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gwaa fó mbwó mèŋ é kẅé Yelúzálèm páʼɔɔn, mbà pɛ̌ na messé mɔɔn lǎ táte wɔ́ɔn légwoon mengwòŋ mɔ́b ńkẅé?»
en: Who among all the gods of the lands has rescued his land from my power? So will the Lord rescue Jerusalem from my power? ’ ”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm pie é laa jʉʼó pú ńdáŋte, alagá nyìŋ té pÿɛ. Ńtí nue fùɔ Ezekiyásè la gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ jÿɔ́ʼ mencwò mɔ́b.
en: But the people kept silent; they did not answer him at all, for the king’s command was, “Don’t answer him.”

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, Eliakim, míŋ Hikiya gẅie à laa nyìŋ gẅie yé zɔ pǔ ńdíe shúm nɔʼ, Shʉbna ntẅènzóŋ mbɔɔ Yowa, míŋ Asáfè wembàŋa, lùŋncwò fùɔ, pɔ́ shʉate menzsǒ mɔ́b ńgʉa shwóŋo Ezekiyásè nò gie tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù we Asili gɔ̌ɔn.
en: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the court secretary, and Joah son of Asaph, the court historian,   came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn  # 18:37 2Kg 6:30; Is 33:7 and reported to him the words of the royal spokesman.
